concept.title: Collecting diagnostics by using the cbcollect_info tool
concept.shortdesc: You can start, stop, and get collection status by using the cbcollect_info tool.

conbody.draft-comment: Can you still output to a specific file if you are not doing the upload option?
conbody.p: The cbcollect_info tool uses the following syntax:

strow.stentry: Enable upload mode. When you use this option, you must also specify the --upload-host and --customer options, and you can optionally specify the --ticket option.

Fully-qualified domain name of the host you want the logs uploaded to. The protocol prefix of the domain name, https://, is optional. It is the default only supported protocol. This option is required when you specify the --upload option.

Customer name. This value is a string with a maximum length of 50 characters that contains only the following characters: [A-Za-z0-9_.-]. If any other characters are included in the string, the request will be rejected. This option is required when you specify the --upload option.

Couchbase support ticket number. This value is a string with a maximum length of 7 character that contains only digits 0-9. The ticket number is optional and is used only in conjunction with the --upload option.
Send output to stdout in script mode format. Use this option when you invoke cbcollect_info programatically.

conbody.p: If the --upload option is used, the collected logs are compressed into a zip file and uploaded to a URL that has the following form: protocol://hostname/customer-name/ticket-number/filename.zip.
